general.headline: Paralegal and Admin Assistant; YMCA Queensland Youth Parliament Executive Volunteer; Undergraduate Law, Commerce and French Student
general.description:
I am a second year student at the University of Queensland, studying a Bachelor of Laws/Commerce and a Diploma in Languages (French). 

As an individual I am passionate about mentoring individuals in both a professional and personal setting. For me personally, I believe that mentoring plays an important role in the transfer of information between team members and the growth of individuals as a whole. 

As an executive member of the YMCA’s Queensland Youth Parliament, it is my role to provide parliamentary education to 93 Youth Members of Parliament. Furthermore, as a Parliamentary Officer, I liaise with Youth Members and State Members of Parliament to create opportunities for Youth Members to engage with community programs and initiatives in their electorates. 

I am also involved with the University of Queensland’s Young Scholars Program, transition from year 12 into University life.  

I possess an unrivalled love for the French language, having studied the language since 2012 and supported by my studies at university. My passion for the language is evinced through my exchange to Nantes in 2015/2016, my interests in French history and my aspirations to continue my university studies and eventually live and work in France.

Furthermore, I an active member of parkrun: an organisation that provides free, weekly, 5KM timed runs across the world. As both a recreational runner who loves partaking in community runs, I have witnessed the importance of parkrun in local communities, connecting communities, whilst also providing an avenue for physical exercise.

general.headline: Photographer
general.description:
How many jobs are there that list tripping over one of the Queens corgis as a workplace hazard?

I was eight when I decided to be a photographer; I don't really think I had a choice. Apart from obstacles of the royal canine variety, it's thrown me an amazing array of challenges and given me some experiences that only come along once in a very lucky person's lifetime. 

If I'm not behind a camera I'm often on the water on some sort of sailboat; using an age old technique to harness the wind to go somewhere just makes so much sense. When you're in the thick of it you can't think about anything else (or you get wet). 

Being a photographer is the perfect excuse to meet and collaborate with people from different walks of life and share their world for a while. It also satisfies another desire: solving technical and logistical issues which again, like sailing if done well no one gets wet.

To do what I love makes me feel incredibly fortunate, always working hard to create dramatic images that tell a story, to draw you into a scene and to capture your imagination. My three wonderful kids remind me everyday to see the world with amazement and it’s a privilege to be able to share the way I see it.

If you have a project you would like to discuss or you just feel like a coffee and a chat then feel free to give me a call.

Paul

Phone: +61 418 644 705

Email: paul@paulharrisphotographer.com
www.paulharrisphotographer.com
Instagram www.instagram.com/paulharris/

general.headline: Founding Director and CEO at Conpago
general.description:
With a background in the health and fitness industry and a bachelor’s degree in Business Management, I have always been passionate about social entrepreneurship. After developing my management skills in several jobs and organisations, I got the fantastic opportunity to co-found Conpago, a tech aged care company dedicated to innovating aged care and combating social isolation among elderly.

As the CEO, I am responsible for the management and strategic direction of Conpago, as well as building valuable relationships and partnerships in the sector. At Conpago, it is our mission to bring families together by changing the way we connect, which is something close to my heart. I am strongly dedicated to improving the lives and wellbeing of elderly while at the same time innovating aged care and solving the challenges of an ageing society.

I am skilled in public speaking, sales, management and research and work with young entrepreneurs to mentor them through the intricate process of starting their own enterprise, which comes with challenges that I myself am all too familiar with. During the years, I greatly developed my interpersonal skills and creative thinking.

Feel free to reach out to me or find out more about Conpago: 
http://conpago.com.au/
http://conpago.com.au/conpagosuite/

jobs.companyName: The Royal Commonwealth Society - Queensland Branch
jobs.description:
The Royal Commonwealth Society, founded in 1868, is a network of individuals and organisations committed to improving the lives and prospects of Commonwealth citizens across the world.

Through youth empowerment, education and advocacy, the Royal Commonwealth Society promotes the value and the values of the Commonwealth. We champion human rights, democracy and sustainable development across the 53 member states which are intrinsically linked through their common history and shared values.

For more info, visit www.thercsqld.org.au

Specialities: Media | Stakeholder Engagement | Strategic Communications | Constituent
      
      Management | Social Media | Speech Writing | Policy Development

The Australian Monarchist League is a non-profit, voluntarily-staffed, membership-based organisation with its primary aim to retain Australia as a constitutional monarchy. To this end it actively monitors the status of the Constitution, informs the public on aspects of politics and government which affect or might affect the smooth running of the monarchy in Australia, maintains a website, a Facebook group, a regular newsletter, and informs the public of the benefits of our system of government through conferences, discussion papers, providing material for schools, and answering enquiries.

With over a thousand years of historical development our monarchy has adapted to changing times, but it never ceases to dedicate itself to the protection of the people for whom it is responsible. Its checks and balances on power ensure that our basic freedoms remain free from the grasp of politicians. Australia has always been a monarchy and we are entirely convinced that Australia is a stable and vibrant country today for that reason.

For info info, please visit www.monarchist.org.au
Media spokespersons: www.amlmedia.info

jobs.companyName: Minister for Education, Training and Employment.
jobs.description:
In my role as Assistant Policy Adviser I:
•	Analyse and prepare reports, briefing notes, submissions and statistical information and associated correspondence.
•	Coordinate and undertake research on Government policy issues and provide advice to senior Ministerial staff.
•	Assist in the preparation of speeches and media statements.
•	Monitor and advise on legislation and policy developments in Queensland, interstate and overseas.
•	Liaise with Ministerial Offices, Departmental officers, private sector organisations and community groups in undertaking research and analysis duties.
•	Assist the Senior Policy Advisor/Policy Advisors in the performance of their duties.

In my capacity as Backbench Liaison Officer (BLO) I:
•	Keep a watching brief on incoming and outgoing correspondence from MPs.
•	Liaise with relevant policy/media advisors to provide informal (email, fax) advice to MPs in a timely fashion.
•	Take calls from MPs, alert Senior Policy Advisor, Chief of Staff or Minister if the issue is of particular importance.
•	Organise – 
-	The backbench committee during parliamentary sitting weeks, including keynote addresses, policy briefings, and briefings on legislation;
-	Interstate or intrastate trips to inspect policy initiatives
-	Drop in sessions for Members during parliament weeks with Minister; and
-	Visits by departmental officers to resolve issues that MPs may have with constituents.
•	Alert MPs when a Minister is visiting an electorate.
•	Work with MPs to develop good news announcements in their electorates (call and response).  Liaise with media advisors to distribute media release templates.  
•	Identify emerging themes in electorates and regions and distribute key lines to MPs on hot issues.
•	Delegate declined invites to MPs.

•	Raise awareness of our organisation
•	Liaise with members
•	Liaise with public
•	Liaise with politicians – State & Federal
•	Lobbying of Government to retain the Australian constitution in its current form, protecting the Crown, and the Australian flag
•	Organise online advertorial material
•	General Administration
•	Educate the public about our constitutional arrangements
•	Plan functions

I have been a member of the Australian Monarchist League since 2007. In November of 2009 I was nominated and elected to the National Council (Executive) as a Youth and Online Policy Liaison. Working voluntarily for this not-for-profit organisation has allowed me to gain a greater appreciation of the Australian political system, and to grow in confidence with my written communication, public speaking, managerial and organisational skills. I personally devise advertising campaigns online/via social media for the League, which has proved highly successful. As a result of these campaigns over 50 per cent of new memberships to AML are under the age of 35. This has ensured our organisations growth, sustainability and longevity well into the future.

general.headline: Compliance Coordinator at NIOA | Managing Director at Whitecliff Advisory
general.description:
Growing up on a sugar cane farm in North Queensland enshrined in me a robust work ethic with a strong focus on getting any task done properly and on time. 

This has greatly assisted me in working in various capacities for State and Federal Members of Parliament since 2006. Working in such positions has given me the ability to work under pressure in addition to demonstrating sound judgment. 

I have an established myself as a leader with ability to adapt and drive change from the front with a focus on achieving results.

Throughout my career I have always thrived on challenging situations and went above and beyond what was required of me. I work to tight timeframes while maintain a high standard of work, displaying initiative and self-motivation while inspiring and leading others to do so. 

Having worked in the Executive Arm of Government I comprehend the importance of being well organised, personable, flexible, discreet and autonomous. 

The ability to solve complex problems and resolve issues is an essential skill for a Policy Advisor and a skill that I competently possess along with priority setting and high quality interpersonal skills. 

The type and level of projects I have been involved in allowed me to develop skills in the following areas:
 • Not for profit management and leadership
 • Policy and Strategy development
 • Stakeholder relations and management 
 • Financial management
 • Whole of government and cross sector initiatives
 • Provision of strategic advice to senior executives and management
 • Issues management
 • Campaign design, implementation and evaluation 
 • Research design, analysis and evaluation
 • Marketing/media/communications strategies

jobs.description:
NIOA is Australia’s largest privately-owned supplier of arms and ammunition to the sporting, law enforcement and military markets.  Representing over 50 international partners, NIOA is Australia and New Zealand’s portal to some of the world’s largest defence companies.  NIOA is fully licenced and accredited including ISO9001:2015 accreditation for the marketing, importation, distribution, integration, and through-life support of firearms, weapons systems, ammunition and related products. 

Main duties include ensuring all activities of the business are carried out within the regulatory framework of Queensland, interstate and Commonwealth legislation and regulation, US International Traffic in Arms Regulations, UN Arms Trade Treaty, and the EU Arms Export Control Code.  

Other duties include keeping abreast of regulatory developments, advising on potential opportunities to be gained through regulatory changes, formulating policy and legislative submissions, identifying opportunities to utilise the Australia US Defence Trade Cooperation Treaty, and assisting with implementation procedures and internal controls to mitigate compliance risk.

Whitecliff Advisory is a specialist advisory firm providing expert guidance and counsel
      to industry and business on policy formulation, implementation, and evaluation.
      Whitecliff can also assist with growth opportunities and government relations including
      
      tendering and procurement.

Founded in 2007, Wounded Heroes is a registered charity organisation established to support Australian servicemen and women and their families, and to ease the financial, emotional and personal hardships of contemporary military life.  Wounded Heroes does whatever it takes to fund support services for deployed personnel, the wounded and their families.  This is principally done by providing short-term emergency relief payments to individuals and their families, although funds are also available for other purposes where a need exists.

jobs.description:
Main duties include providing expert advice to the Premier, key Ministers and senior staff  on issues facing Members of Parliament and their electorates, in addition to providing communication support and guidance to Members of Parliament, including Ministers, Assistant Ministers, Backbenchers and their staff. 

Other duties include liaising with Ministers, Members of Parliament, electorate and ministerial staff to achieve outcomes in Members’ electorates. Additional duties include:

-   Assisting Members and staff with local media strategy, including media releases, newsletters and social media
-   Issue and crisis management 
-   Research and report writing 
-   Provide advice to Members and their staff on Parliamentary processes and procedures
-   Develop incumbency strategies for Members including communications and fundraising plans, grassroots campaign and micro-campaign plans, and direct mail pieces
-   Assist the Premier and Leader of the House by preparing briefings for the Parliamentary Party Room
-   Assist with creation and delivery of training program for government staff

jobs.companyName: Office of the Minister for Communities, Child Safety and Disability Services
jobs.description:
Main duties include identifying, developing and analysing complex policy options and advising on major policy issues relating to disability services and the $22 billion National Disability Insurance Scheme (NDIS), in addition to monitoring and evaluating the implementation of the Queensland Disability Plan 2014-19. 

Projects include having a leading role in the development and signing of a Memorandum of Understanding between the Queensland and Australian Governments regarding the roll out of the NDIS in Queensland through the establishment of the National Disability Insurance Agency in Queensland. 

Other responsibilities include participating in forums such as the Queensland Disability Advisory Council and the Queensland NDIS Planning and Implementation Group. 

Additional responsibilities include preparing and developing Parliamentary Briefing Notes for the Minister and approving responses to Question on Notice in legislative timeframes.

Other duties are providing expert and timely advice to the Minister on policy issues and liaising with departmental officers in relation to the preparation of policy and legislative documents, and correspondence, in addition to preparing and contributing to the preparation of timely and well researched submissions, discussion papers, reports, policy statements and briefing notes on a range of issues.

Other key duties include preparing and developing Parliamentary Briefing Notes for the Minister and approving responses to Question on Notice in legislative timeframes.

Projects include leading the development of the Queensland Small Business Strategy and Action Plan 2013-2015, as well as leading and coordinating the highly successful ‘Think Queensland, buy locally’ small business campaign, the inaugural Queensland Small Business Week and the ‘Buy locally’ Saturday campaign.

Extra responsibilities include participating in consultative forums, such as the Queensland Small Business Advisory Council, in regards to policy matters and assisting in the provision of secretariat support to policy bodies and committees. 

Other duties are providing expert and timely advice to the Minister on policy issues and liaising with departmental officers in relation to the preparation of policy and legislative documents, and correspondence, in addition to preparing and contributing to the preparation of timely and well researched submissions, discussion papers, reports, policy statements and briefing notes on a range of issues.

general.headline: Working on something really exciting!
general.description: Experienced executive with a demonstrated history of working in operational and public policy environments - Government, Media Relations, Corporate Communications, Management, and Leadership. Strong stakeholder and professional skills - graduated from University of Western Sydney.

jobs.description:
The role varied on a daily basis – it included strategy, long-term planning, high-level strategic advice, stakeholder engagement, media and staff management together with analysis of other industry participants. This constant variance demands the management of a vast range of different tasks and requires a keen eye for prioritisation and timeliness of response. 

As Chief of Staff, once a decision is made, it needs to hold up to scrutiny - so vital elements of my decision making processes include consultation, collaboration and contextualisation. 

Throughout my career, I have actively employed a wide ranging consultation mechanism. I prefer to consult with a diverse group of people, whose views and opinions may differ from mine. This is vital to ensuring the correct contextualisation is achieved as part of any decision making process. This is also vital for sound strategy development and analytical advice.  I have always believed you must understand your target audience in order to align their needs with your organisation’s desired outcome. My approach ensures flexibility through employing a comprehensive style of game theory to decision making – in order to ensure all bases are covered and all strategic outcomes considered. 

 As a leader, I know that the buck stops with me and it is incumbent on me to be aware in order to achieve the very best results. 

I was responsible for twenty one staff across the Opposition office. We established a digital and data unit to build voter profiles through greater social media engagement and interaction. This unit sat alongside and worked in harmony with policy, media and administration. Team building and managing adults in a high tempo work environment within a public arena requires exceptional interpersonal skills.  My team was highly-regarded for our professionalism, skills and output.

jobs.jobTitle: Executive General Manager - Marketing, Government and Public Affairs
jobs.description:
As the Executive General Manager, Government and Public Affairs, I was brought in to deepen the relationship between the Careers Australia Group and its Government clients, across all States and Territories. 

I was the first internal Government relations and public affairs person the Group had hired.  A number of mature issues were running and I had to get across them quickly to prevent adverse public commentary.

The challenging environment was complicated by an ever changing regulatory environment. Each time there was an issue within the wider vocational education and training system (VET) a new set of government regulations, either at State or Federal level were enacted, altering the field of operation.

Careers Australia had over 1000 staff, 17 campuses across Australia and Asia and a turnover of over $300 million annually.

The broader Careers Australia Group encompassed numerous brands and businesses, ranging from a call and student support centre in Manila to a Higher Education Institution in Melbourne to an experiential learning technology company in Sydney called Workstar or AIPRO, a culinary school in Indonesia. All parts of the Group were used to deliver students a unique learning environment with flexibility and hands on experience. I was responsible for  Marketing, Government and Public Affairs advice across all businesses. 
 
I was also charged with internal communications as well as external communications, which resulted in national media appearances on the ABC 7.30 Report and the redesign of certain internal teams.  

Given a challenging external environment, I maintained and increased student inquiry levels, manage adverse public media, kept a team of 16 people motivated, scale up our higher education resources and reform all VET resources to ensure compliance. This occurred, while keeping our Government and non-Government stakeholders fully informed and up to date, through regular forums, newsletters and personal meetings.

I was responsible for leading all Government (Federal, State and Local) sales and accounts across Queensland. The role is based on multiple publications in Cairns, Townsville, Brisbane and the Gold Coast. I was responsible for initiating, developing and directing business strategies and activities to achieve multi-platform revenue and sales in a cost-effective manner. The position provides all levels of Government with a single point of contact across the many News Corp assets. 

I was also responsible for fostering excellent customer and stakeholder relationships to service a range of existing and new clients in order to exceed performance targets. Key to this is the delivery of innovative commercial partnerships for customers to maximise revenue and client outcomes. 

The development of strategies that link the organisation’s broader goals and objectives, to revenue opportunities across the Government portfolio, occurs on a daily basis. These development strategies include the need to mentor staff and build knowledge of and capability within the Government team.

jobs.companyName: Office of the Queensland Treasurer and Minister for Trade
jobs.description:
The role was multifaceted and dictated to by a fast paced environment which changed on a daily basis. I was responsible for ensuring the most senior economic Minister in the Newman Government proactively enhanced the Government’s standing and/or was available to respond to issues, together with carrying out the statutory obligations of his office.

The Chief of staff is responsible for the management and co-ordination of a two million dollar office budget and sixteen ministerial staff. I was a member of six cabinet committees across Government, most importantly the Cabinet Budget Review Committee. Annually, this Committee reviewed over forty nine billion dollars in expenditure. The office, together with senior Treasury officials, was responsible for the review process, organisation of and ultimately the publication of the State Budget.

The managerial and decision making focus of the role meant that I needed to understand and be prepared for the risks and impact of risks on our workflow, activity, forward plans and public messaging.

The provision of detailed strategic advice, often under pressure and at short notice, was common, whether it was in high level meetings with industry or stakeholders, policy discussions or contract negotiations. 

The role was strongly focused on the effective order and running of the office and department to ensure that accurate and robust advice was given to decision makers and other parts of Government to enhance co-ordination and outcome success.

As Chief of staff I was also responsible for providing high level strategic advice on the numbers within the budget, financial models, macroeconomic forecasts and broader economic trends.

Combining wide ranging communication skills, informed decision making and a strong understanding of politics and governance, I played a key role in co-ordinating the Government’s economic agenda, the story of their successes and their future direction.

This unique role is similar to that of a Chief Operating Officer in terms of the day-to-day management and forward planning in the period leading up to the 2012 Queensland State Election. 

The role involved constant consultation with the party executive (similar to a Board of Directors), party members, eighty nine campaign teams (similar to 89 offices across Qld) at a local level, campaign staff, designers, advertising agencies, printers and production houses, as well as the leader and his staff. 

Initially, a blank canvas dictated the need for a road map and victory plan to be compiled, tested and socialised. This was done through a series of meetings, away weekends and regional forums with key party members and key members of the parliamentary wing. Early-on, systems and processes were established to build a team culture but also to enhance campaign discipline and limit resource wasting, including staff time.

This plan then needed to be actioned and grounded in reality, given our expenditure cap of 
$7.12 million combined with the desire to adequately service a large number of key electorates. This challenge meant tailored victory plans were developed for each electorate in close consultation with the candidate/member whilst being consistent and true to the broader plan.

Significant internal matters needed to be resolved. Disappointment from earlier events and lethargy had to be overcome. In part, some lethargy dissolved over time, but communication discipline had to be tailored to specific audiences in different ways to ensure a single common purpose. This meant the development and targeting of smart, useful messages and events. 

The campaign result saw the LNP win seventy eight of the eighty nine seats with a primary vote of 49.66% reducing Labor to seven members. This was the first time since 1975 that a political party had won more than sixteen seats to win Government.

Employed to provide fresh perspectives on a mature business with existing clients, my role at Enhance Corporate was to test and retest the assumptions in advice given to clients, while developing future clients and servicing existing clients.

Having come from the client side of the consultant-client relationship at the National Rugby League, I had gained invaluable insight into client needs and how best to meet those needs.

This was the inaugural government relations and strategy position created at the National Rugby League. Given the position had not existed before, both internally and externally, the position had to be justified through a strong results focus to ensure its ongoing continuity.  Today, the organisation has a government relations manager in each eastern seaboard state with several additional resources at NRL headquarters. 

This was a particularly challenging role given the management team at the NRL had been in place for over seven years without any change. As a result, I had to embrace the status quo while subtly making changes which enabled people to feel comfortable while advancing the objectives and key performance metrics of the position. 
 
Importantly, the position called on bringing the grassroots elements of Rugby League (its volunteer base) on the journey to develop and implement strategies and improved ways of operating. This was and remains critical to the success of the overall positioning of the brand as well as the long term future of the organisation.

general.headline: Business Development
general.company: Retail Rebranded-27 secrets of market leaders
general.description:
With 30 years experience in business, negotiation, management, merchandising and consulting and qualifications in marketing, business, retail management and training delivery, Angie Bell is well equipped to lead in her field. Angie has worked in all Australian states and territories and travelled extensively throughout China, South East Asia, the Americas and Europe researching marketing trends and best retail practice. In her early career, she was twice commended by the Australian Music Industry as an outstanding sales representative and later awarded an academic achievement from Griffith University’s Business School. Her advice to retailers and small business has been published on the Telstra website, in Ragtrader Magazine and in Australian Hardware Journal. Angie specialises in building, implementing and measuring development models and is an expert in rebranding and merchandising.

Her book has been endorsed by the former Treasurer, Joe Hockey and the National Retail Association. Angie is currently the National Business Development Manager at Paint Place Group of Stores, overseeing 100 paint retail and trade outlets. She volunteers as the President of the Liberal National Party Women in Queensland leading a team to support women in politics. She is an honorary member of the LNP Small Business Policy Forum, Gold Coast and the Golden Key International Honour Society. Ms. Bell's book 'Retail Rebranded-27 Secrets of Market Leaders' is part of the marketing curriculum at Griffith University and at the Copenhagen Business School (CBS), Denmark. It is is available now from Amazon, Barnes & Noble and Balboa Press.

general.headline: Undergraduate Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering Student at the Queensland University of Technology | Aspiring Aeronautical Engineer
general.description:
I am an undergraduate Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering student with a passion for creating and influencing change. I am an active member of the Queensland community, with an insatiable passion for aviation, engineering, history, politics, technology, music and cricket. I have a deep interest in community outreach and engagement through a diverse range of volunteering. I am motivated, proactive, highly adaptable and strive to complete all tasks to impeccably high standards. 

Since my childhood, I have possessed an unquenchable passion for aviation. As such, I have chosen to pursue studies in both Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering through the Queensland University of Technology (QUT). Through my studies of both engineering disciplines, I have gained extensive knowledge of the electrical, mechanical, software and computing principles that underpin many of the systems used within modern aerospace applications. I feel the cross-knowledge of mechanical, electrical and aerospace systems provides me with a unique 'systems' perspective which can be used across a wide range of potential applications within the aerospace sphere. I have a particular interest in the fusion of electronic and weapons systems within the field of military aviation. 

I have a developed interest in trading and investing financial assets, which formed a large component of my previous role as a Commodities Analyst (Metals) and a member of the executive council within STIA, an innovative start up in Brisbane's financial sector. In my role with STIA, I have been exposed to a variety of both technical and fundamental analysis methods in the analysis of global financial markets. 

In my private time, I throughly enjoy furthering my fervid interest in Russian culture, history, literature and language. 

I am seeking challenging and fulfilling Aerospace Engineering opportunities within both the Australian Defence Force and the International Aerospace and Defence industries.

jobs.description: Paralegal in the IPT team

McPhee IT is an information technology consulting firm providing support for small to medium business clients throughout Queensland. I started the business in 2008 in response to the high demand for quality IT services in the Central Queensland area. 

Key tasks and responsibilities: 

Managed a team of ten technical and administrative staff, servicing more than 200 clients throughout the Central Queensland region.

Built a trusted and recognisable local brand and developed an innovative suite of service offerings, from ad-hoc support to managed services, planning and consulting, website development, and graphic design.

Worked with clients to understand their businesses and tailor solutions to their needs.

Developed innovative solutions to overcome the technical challenges faced by businesses in rural and remote areas.

Gained a sound understanding of bookkeeping, business accounting and compliance, including BAS reporting and employer obligations.

Developed a high level of proficiency across a range of technology platforms from various vendors, including Microsoft, Apple, HP, Toshiba, Cisco, VMware, Netgear, Adobe, and more.

Restructured the business in response to the growing emphasis on cloud technologies and refocused around several key customers in the medical and logistics industries.

general.description:
I am a consultant with EY's Tax Technology & Transformation group based in Melbourne, specialising in tax performance improvement, tax governance and strategy, tax risk management, data analytics, and process automation.

My technical skillset includes:
  •  Advanced usage of Microsoft Office suite programs, in particular Excel (including VBA), Word, and PowerPoint
  •  Basic software programming skills in VB.NET, C#, and C++
  •  Advanced web development skills using HTML5 and various frameworks such as AngularJS
  •  Data analytics, blending, visualisation, and econometric & statistical analysis using various software including Tableau, PowerBI, and Alteryx
  •  Robotics process automation using software such as Blue Prism and UiPath
  •  Proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite, including image manipulation, animation & compositing, and vector manipulation & ray tracing

I graduated from The University of Melbourne with a Bachelor of Commerce (majors in Economics and Finance) in 2015. I am currently completing my Graduate Diploma in Chartered Accounting (Chartered Accountants Australia and New Zealand).

During my free time I can usually be found enjoying a good fantasy or science-fiction novel. I enjoy building scale and LEGO models, and always look forward to heading outdoors for a hiking or camping trip.

With nearly 15 years experience in this area, I thoroughly enjoy working with businesses to problem solve and ensure they are technically compliant in relation to Fringe Benefits Tax (FBT), PAYG withholding, Superannuation Guarantee, Payroll Tax, and Salary Packaging. 

More recently, I have been involved in the development of an FBT automation service.  This is a 'game changer' for EY and businesses.  FBT automation, along with our data analytics offering for payroll, marks only the beginning of our digital offering.  It will be exciting to see how employment taxes continues to evolve in this area.

My current client base ranges from large multinationals, to private Australian companies and not for profits.

One of my favourite quotes that has helped form my view of relationships with my clients is from Anthony Podesta (founder of McMillan Shakesphere and winner of the 2012 Australian Ernst & Young Entrepreneur of the Year).  Anthony posed the question, "...are you engaged with your clients, or just dancing?". This forms part of my daily motto, to ensure that I have deep and strong relationships with my clients, so as to provide them with the most relevant and highest level of service. 

I also believe that leadership is more than a title.  I'm excited and honoured to work with a vibrant group of individuals.  I hope to lead by example, on a foundation of honesty, hard work and humour.  We foster an environment where the team can develop their strengths and are supported in achieving their career and personal goals.

general.headline: Experienced Transfer Pricing Advisor - Ernst & Young

jobs.description:
At Ernst & Young we bring you a global perspective based on our long-standing experience of what really works in transfer pricing and supply chain management (SCM).

Our multi-disciplinary Transfer Pricing and SCM teams work with you on supply chain design, business restructuring, systems implications, transfer pricing, direct and indirect tax, customs and accounting. We can help you build and implement the structure that makes sense for your business, improve your processes and manage the cost of trade.

We can help you review, document, manage and defend your transfer pricing policies and processes - aligning them with your business strategy. We work with you to build the proactive, pragmatic and integrated strategies that address the tax risks of today's businesses and help your business achieve its potential.

We can help you with:

- Transfer pricing advice
- Global documentation
- Global transfer pricing controversy and risk management
- Tax efficient supply chain management
- Transfer pricing in financial services
- Transfer pricing and customs

general.headline: Director - Global Advisory Learning Leader - Asia Pacific
general.description:
Learning is my passion and I also an ambassador for diversity and inclusion.
As a recognized leader & expert in Learning and Leadership Development, I lead the Advisory learning team across Asia Pacific to support over 10,000 Advisory professionals, along with leading key global learning designs for over 45,000 Advisory professionals worldwide.  Consulting to Senior Partners across EMEIA, APAC, the Americas and Japan in one of the largest consulting business globally, we drive change, business growth and ensure future skills development to support our client’s future success.

I began my career in learning and development in the UK and Europe as a facilitator and designer for leading travel retail organisation Thomas Cook. This started my passion for learning and I delivered
programs in sales, customer service and leadership for 10 years across the UK.
For the next 4 years I led a new training team who provided learning for over 600 employees in a contact centre for one of the largest European telecommunication organisations (TMobile).
I later created Funky Thinking Ltd which where I worked as a Mind Gym facilitator for 3 years, working with key client accounts including The BBC, Deutsche Bank, and Hewlett Packard across Europe.

In my current role as APAC Advisory Learning Leader, I lead Global learning designs on Analytics and AI, and Future Consulting Skills which supports a Global Audience of up to 45,000 employees, and also lead the learning and development of 10,000 Staff to Partners across Asia Pacific.

As an ambassador for diversity and inclusion, I became the Chair of our EY Oceania Unity, supporting diversity and inclusiveness throughout EY. In the last 6 years we grew from a network of 70 members to over 1200 members representing all EY locations in Australia and NZ.  One of my proudest moments came in May 2018 when EY Unity won Employer of the Year for LGBTI Inclusion in the Australia Workplace Equality Awards.

Widely respected and inspiring coach, consultant & facilitator with expertise in leadership, diversity, mental health in mining, construction, LGBTI, FIFO, positive workplaces, positive psychology, organisational development & career transition. Facilitated significant & positive outcomes through raising awareness of the link between mental health & marriage equality.

general.headline: Partner at Colin Biggers & Paisley
general.description:
Julian Mellick is a Partner in the construction and engineering team at CBP.  He has 13+ years' experience providing legal solutions to government, principal, contractor, consultant and supplier clients located across Australia and the Asia Pacific region.  

Julian has been ranked as a Rising Star in Australian Construction & Infrastructure (2016, Doyles Guide) and is a co-author of a textbook on Contract Law (2016, LexisNexis Butterworths).

His practice focuses on the following 4 areas:  
+ Projects - Preparing, negotiating, administering and advising on project docs to address commercial risks and opportunities and deliver projects on time and to budget.   
+ Disputes - Using legal strategies and tools to avoid, minimise and resolve conflict including via ADR, litigation and other means.
+ Compliance - Providing workshops, training, tools and updates to help clients with their quality/compliance controls.  
+ Best practice - implementing and monitoring systems to assist in-house clients decrease spend  and simplify tasks.  

Recent projects include:
+  defending a foreign government in arbitrations concerning various road infrastructure projects 
+  preparing international supply agreements for a manufacturer, with associated advisory work
+  partnering with a government energy generator to prepare their pro-forma upgrade contracts 
+  advising a ministerial holding corporation re works on Australia's largest power station
+  acting for the EPC contractor in disputes on a significant ($10B+) iron ore mine
+  acting for one of the world's largest turbine suppliers on a major NZ energy project
+  drafting contract docs for an ASX listed EPC re TfNSW traction power upgrade projects
+  reviewing/drafting GSA/TESA contracts for energy generation facilities
+  advising architects on part of the $2B Frasers Central Park urban development

Julian is admitted to practice in the NSW Supreme Court and the High Court of Australia.

Damien Butler is a restructuring and insolvency lawyer based in Brisbane.

He acts both for and against financial institutions, as well as insolvency practitioners and their clients involved in complex insolvent administrations of businesses ranging from large-scale mining operations to land developers.

Damien conducts litigation and mediations for a number of major banks and financial institutions in cases including complex security enforcements, cheque forgery and third-party cheque cases, litigated customer disputes, and other potentially sensitive customer and reputation risk matters. In addition, he manages a secured recovery team processing volume enforcement of security matters for major banks and financial institutions.

His areas of expertise are insolvency, banking and financial services advice and litigation, Corporations Act advice and litigation.

Damien was voted by peers as one of Australia's best lawyers in Insolvency and Reorganisation - Best Lawyers Australia, 2013.

His major clients include CBA (including Bankwest), NAB, ANZ and Esanda, Challenger, HSBC, Citibank, McGrathNicol, FTI, KordaMentha, PPB, Grant Thornton, Ernst & Young, BDO and Pilot Partners.

While studying Toby worked as a Japanese tutor and business translator. 

Outside work, Toby is interested in linguistics and grammar systems, and fences épée at the Rozelle and the UTS Fencing Clubs. He is also a co-inventor of an image archiving model for which a patent application is pending.

Private Clients team - tax, superannuation and trusts

Overview:
+ advising clients (including high net wealth individuals, public companies and universities) on State revenue (payroll tax and duties) and Federal revenue (income tax and CGT) laws

Recently:
+ successful Revenue NSW objections, regarding payroll tax contractor provisions, reducing payroll tax liability of over $500,000 to nil
+ successful ATO private ruling application, for Commissioner to extend time period for deceased estate dwelling CGT exemption, from 2 to nearly 4 years
+ advice on wide range of tax matters including commercial debt forgiveness, carry-forward company tax losses, attributed personal services income, income-capital distinction, payroll tax grouping provisions and contractor provisions, GST treatment of educational institution's provision of accommodation

Working on landmark case, as part of litigation and dispute resolution team:
